ca.uqac.lif.fs

Class ThrottledFileSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uqac.lif.fs.FilterFileSystem
      • ca.uqac.lif.fs.ThrottledFileSystem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FileSystem
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FloppyDisk

    public class ThrottledFileSystem
extends FilterFileSystem
    A file system that imposes size and/or speed limits on the access to another file system.

    A particular example of throttled file system is the FloppyDisk, which caps both capacity and transfer speed to that of vintage disk drives.

    Author:
    Sylvain Hall√©

    • Field Detail

      • m_speedLimit

        protected long m_speedLimit
        The transfer speed limit, in bytes per second. Set to -1 to impose no limit.

      • m_sizeLimit

        The maximum capcity, in bytes. Set to -1 to impose no limit.

      • setSpeedLimit

        public void setSpeedLimit(long speed)
        Sets the transfer speed limit of this file system.
        Parameters:

      • setSizeLimit

        public void setSizeLimit(long size)
        Sets the maximum capacity of this file system.
        Parameters:
        size - The maximum capcity, in bytes; set to -1 to impose no limit

      • getMaxSize

        protected long getMaxSize()
        Gets the maximum size of the drive.
        Returns:
        The size, in bytes. If no limit is specified, it returns Long.MAX_VALUE.

      • getMaxSpeed

        protected long getMaxSpeed()
        Gets the maximum transfer speed of the drive.
        Returns:
        The speed, in bytes per second. If no limit is specified, it returns Long.MAX_VALUE.

      • writeTo

        public java.io.OutputStream writeTo(java.lang.String filename)
                             throws FileSystemException
        Description copied from interface: FileSystem
        Writes data to a file. The method provides an OutputStream to which data can be printed. The data is guaranteed to be committed to the file only when the print stream is closed. Whether data is written before that moment depends on the actual file system implementation.
        Specified by:
        writeTo in interface FileSystem
        Overrides:
        writeTo in class FilterFileSystem
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the file to which data is to be written
        Returns:
        An output stream open on the file. If the method successfully returns, it guarantees that this stream is not null
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - Thrown if the operation could not be performed for some reason

        public java.io.InputStream readFrom(java.lang.String filename)
                             throws FileSystemException
        Description copied from interface: FileSystem
        Reads data from a file. The method provides an InputStream from which data can be read. Consumers of this input stream have the responsibility to close the stream after usage.
